name: hibachi
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] (also hibachi grill) a small container with a grill (= a frame of metal bars) on top of it, used for cooking food over a fire: Keep the hot dogs warm on a hibachi. The crab had been seared on a tiny hibachi grill.
[ U ] a dish of food cooked over fire on a hibachi grill: I ordered the shrimp hibachi with fried rice. I tried the recipe that she gave me for hibachi chicken.
More examplesFewer examplesYou should definitely buy a cheap hibachi or even a disposable charcoal grill.Some residents were surviving with a hibachi grill and bottled water.Marina life makes you think of flip-flops, Hawaiian shirts, hibachis and cold drinks.Try chunks of fish on skewers over the hibachi with a little Sriracha. Ribs are being turned over the hibachi at a tailgate party.We gathered for a typically Vietnamese style hibachi dinner where you grill your own meats at the table. We thought the hibachi steak was a little plain, but the hibachi salmon was very nice.
